issue.title: Imu and Contact sensors stop publishing after simulation is resetted

content.raw:
This may be related to [gazebo issue 236](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/236). We pushed a fix for the IMU sensor in [gazebo 4.1.2](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/compare/gazebo4_4.1.2%0Dgazebo4_4.1.1). Which version of gazebo are you using?

It could be something different though, perhaps an issue with AtlasPlugin.
content.html:
This may be related to gazebo issue 236. We pushed a fix for the IMU sensor in gazebo 4.1.2. Which version of gazebo are you using?

It could be something different though, perhaps an issue with AtlasPlugin.

issue.title: Imu and Contact sensors stop publishing after simulation is resetted

content.raw: Are you looking at the gazebo topics or ROS topics for sensor updates?
content.html: Are you looking at the gazebo topics or ROS topics for sensor updates?

issue.title: Imu and Contact sensors stop publishing after simulation is resetted

content.raw: Hello, now i have a login :). I'm looking at the ros topics, but as far as i can see, there is no gazebo topic diectly publishing the foot contact sensor data. I'm using the debian install for ubuntu 14.04, this is gazebo 4.1.3-1 and drcsim 5.0.0-1. I had a look at the (gazebo sensor class) code, and I think this is because the needsUpdate() function uses lastMeasurementTime to determine whether the sensor needs a new update, which isn't resetted in the Sensor classes reset function.
content.html: Hello, now i have a login :). I'm looking at the ros topics, but as far as i can see, there is no gazebo topic diectly publishing the foot contact sensor data. I'm using the debian install for ubuntu 14.04, this is gazebo 4.1.3-1 and drcsim 5.0.0-1. I had a look at the (gazebo sensor class) code, and I think this is because the needsUpdate() function uses lastMeasurementTime to determine whether the sensor needs a new update, which isn't resetted in the Sensor classes reset function.
